Package org.jvault.factory.buildinfo

Class PropertiesVaultFactoryBuildInfo

java.lang.Object
org.jvault.factory.buildinfo.AbstractVaultFactoryBuildInfo
org.jvault.factory.buildinfo.PropertiesVaultFactoryBuildInfo
All Implemented Interfaces:
VaultFactoryBuildInfoExtensiblePoint
@API public final class PropertiesVaultFactoryBuildInfo extends AbstractVaultFactoryBuildInfo
Receive the path of *.properties file and specify the return value of the VaultFactoryBuildInfoExtensiblePoint methods.
Below is examples of .properties phrases

org.jvault.vault.name = SOME_VAULT_NAME
- "getVaultName()" method returns a value of org.jvault.vault.name, which will be the name of the vault that was created.

org.jvault.vault.access.packages = org.jvault.factory, org.jvault.util.*
- "getVaultAccessPackages()" method returns a vaule of org.jvault.vault.access.packages, which will be specified range of packages that Vault can inject.

org.jvault.vault.access.classes = org.jvault.factory.buildinfo.AnnotationVaultFactoryBuildInfo
- "getVaultAccessClasses()" method returns a vaule of org.jvault.vault.access.classes, which will be specified class name with path that Vault can inject.

org.jvault.reader.packages = org.jvault, org.jvault.struct.scanwithproperties, org.jvault.*
- The package path where the beans located.
When you use an ".*" expression, it find beans in all child directories and descendant directories to leaf directories, including the path before the expression.
org.jvault.reader.exclude.packages = org.jvault.factory, org.jvault.beans.*
- The path of the package to exclude from the scan.
When you use an ".*" expression, it find beans in all child directories and descendant directories to leaf directories, including the path before the expression.

org.jvault.reader.classes = org.jvault.factory.ClassVaultFactory, org.jvault.factory.buildinfo.AnnotationVaultFactoryBuildInfo
- The class path with class name where the bean located.

Since:
0.1
See Also:

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    protected String[]
    getClassesImpl()
    The implementation of this method should return the path and package of the class.
    The bean of the returned information will be registered in the Vault.
    protected String[]
    getExcludePackagesImpl()
    The implementation of this method should return the package path of the beans to exclude from the scan.
    * expression can be used at the end of the package path,
    and if a .* expression is used at the end of the package path,
    the class in the last leaf directory including the path is excluded from empty scanning.
    protected String[]
    getPackagesImpl()
    This method implementation should return package paths where Beans exist.
    .* expression can be used at the end of the path,
    and if there is a .* expression at the end of the path,
    all classes in the last leaf directory including the path are scanned.

    BuildInfo will create a class that will be Beans based on this information.
    String[]
    getVaultAccessClasses()
    Method that returns the accessible class name with path to which Vault created by VaultFactory
    Only the path of the class specified here can be passed as a parameter of the vault.
    If empty, any class can be passed as a parameter.
    String[]
    getVaultAccessPackages()
    Method that returns the accessible package paths to which Vault created by VaultFactory
    Only the path of the class specified here can be passed as a parameter of the vault.
    String
    getVaultName()
    Method that returns the name of the Vault to be created by VaultFactory.

    • getPackagesImpl

      protected String[] getPackagesImpl()
      Description copied from class: AbstractVaultFactoryBuildInfo
      This method implementation should return package paths where Beans exist.
      .* expression can be used at the end of the path,
      and if there is a .* expression at the end of the path,
      all classes in the last leaf directory including the path are scanned.

      BuildInfo will create a class that will be Beans based on this information.
      Specified by:
      getPackagesImpl in class AbstractVaultFactoryBuildInfo
      Returns:
      String[] Package paths where the scan target beans exists

    • getExcludePackagesImpl

      protected String[] getExcludePackagesImpl()
      Description copied from class: AbstractVaultFactoryBuildInfo
      The implementation of this method should return the package path of the beans to exclude from the scan.
      * expression can be used at the end of the package path,
      and if a .* expression is used at the end of the package path,
      the class in the last leaf directory including the path is excluded from empty scanning.
      Specified by:
      getExcludePackagesImpl in class AbstractVaultFactoryBuildInfo
      Returns:
      String[] Package paths with beans to exclude from scanning
